intro: Gnaphalium viravira, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in compact clusters. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Gnaphalium viravira is often found in meadows, streambanks, and woodland edges, where it contributes to ecological diversity.
